meanings.definition: A type of exercise in which a person lies facing the floor and, keeping their back straight, raises and lowers their body by straightening and bending their arms.
meanings.sent1: She did ten pushups every morning to strengthen her arms.
meanings.sent2: During gym class, the students practiced pushups to improve their fitness.
meanings.sent3: The pushup contest at the park was intense, with everyone trying to outdo each other.
meanings.sent4: His determination to do pushups every day was like a steady beat in his fitness routine.
meanings.sent5: The coach demonstrated the perfect pushup form to the beginners.

meanings.definition: A small mound of earth pushed up by a mole or other burrowing animal.
meanings.sent1: The gardener noticed a fresh pushup of dirt in the flower bed.
meanings.sent2: The pushup near the garden fence indicated the presence of a burrowing creature.
meanings.sent3: The pushup in the lawn puzzled the homeowner, wondering which critter was responsible.
meanings.sent4: The pushup of soil in the yard resembled a tiny mountain in the grass.
meanings.sent5: The pushup of dirt by the tree stump was a clue to the underground activity of the animals.
